qas.question: What was the result of Hayek's Prices and Production?
What is the name of the first book Hayek released to revise his stances from Prices and Production?
Who was particularly critical of Hayek's work following Prices and Production?
Lionel Robbins' The Great Depression was a result of his support for what?

answers.text: the Austrian theory of the business cycle

qas.question: Who did Keynes' arguments against the Austrian theory of the business cycle eventually influence?

context: Hayek continued his research on monetary and capital theory, revising his theories of the relations between credit cycles and capital structure in <a1_0>Profits, Interest and Investment<a1_0/> (1939) and The Pure Theory of Capital (1941), but his reputation as an economic theorist had by then fallen so much that those <a0_0>works were largely ignored<a0_0/>, except for scathing critiques by <a2_0>Nicholas Kaldor<a2_0/>. <a4_0>Lionel Robbins<a4_0/> himself, who had embraced <a3_0>the Austrian theory of the business cycle<a3_0/> in The Great Depression (1934), later regretted having written the book and accepted many of the Keynesian counter-arguments.
